Overproduction occurred when companies produced more goods than people could afford to buy, leading to a surplus of goods and a decrease in prices. Underconsumption occurred when people did not have enough income to purchase the goods being produced, leading to a decrease in demand. The stock market bubble was caused by investors buying stocks on margin, or using borrowed money to buy stocks, which led to a speculative bubble in the stock market.
